title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:10 <mflorea> has quit  
04:06 <sburjan`> has quit  
07:00 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:02 <Denis> has quit  
08:05 <@sdumitriu> Denis1: Do you have something for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-5823 ?  
08:15 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <tekzilla> has quit  
08:38 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:05 <+Denis> sdumitriu: I do not think so  
09:05 <@sdumitriu> I committed something that should improve things  
09:06 <@sdumitriu> But it's still less than perfect, since it will continue to ignore some types of errors  
09:06 <@sdumitriu> Like the out of disk problem  
09:06 <+Denis> that probably why I have tackle this immediately  
09:07 <+Denis> +not  
09:08 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <+tmortagne> crap looks like I hit a clirr bug...  
09:43 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <+Denis> vmassol: hi, implementing comparable for a reference, impose that the map storing parameters should be ordered, is this really needed at the EntityReference level ?  
10:36 <vmassol> no idea  
10:36 <vmassol> I don't recall doing the Comparabiel part, you could check in the history to see who added it (might well be me… ;))  
10:37 <+Denis> it is badly implemented using toString()  
10:37 <+Denis> is that really you ?  
10:37 <vmassol> no idea  
10:37 <vmassol> check the history  
10:38 <+Denis> what I was wondering, is if we could not implement comparable without parameters, and include local/version at the document level for now  
10:39 <vmassol> looks like I did this initially:  
10:39 <vmassol>     public int compareTo(EntityReference reference)  
10:39 <vmassol>     {  
10:39 <vmassol>         return new CompareToBuilder().append(toString(), reference.toString()).toComparison();  
10:39 <vmassol>     }  
10:39 <+Denis> yes  
10:40 <vmassol> I don't know why I implemented Comparable  
10:40 <vmassol> there must have been some reason  
10:40 <+Denis> comparing at document level is useful IMO, but at entity level ?  
10:41 <vmassol> I must have had the need in some use case somewhere but I don't recall  
10:42 <+Denis> at document level, we could do a smart compare, using language and version in that order, but doing it alphabetically ordered by key at entity level is not smart  
10:43 <+Denis> on the other side, we may need the reverse of what I just said  
10:47 <+Denis> mmm, and it is strongly recommended that equals and compareTo be consistant :'(  
11:17 <vmassol> tmortagne: don't you think that it would be best to have a single entry on the admin guide about Multi wikis?  
11:17 <vmassol> we already have "virtual wikis"  
11:18 <vmassol> IMO we start to have too many top level entries in the admin guide  
11:18 <+tmortagne> I wanted to do that at first but virtual wikis page should be refactored for it I think  
11:18 <vmassol> yes definitely  
11:19 <+tmortagne> but yes we have too many things in AdminGuide, we should organize a bit  
11:58 <vmassol> mflorea: hi. Is it normal that I cannot resize an image in chrome when in the wysiwyg editor?  
11:59 <vmassol> answer: no it's not normal…. It works in FF  
11:59 <vmassol> I'll create a jira  
12:02 <+mflorea> vmassol: I haven't checked, could be a limitation of Chrome, i.e. it might not support image resize by default, like FF does.  
12:02 <+mflorea> I don't remember preventing image resize or something like that in the WYSIWYG code  
12:05 <+mflorea> vmassol: can you resize the image from this demo http://ckeditor.com/demo in Chrome?  
12:06 <vmassol> no  
12:07 <vmassol> they have the same problem here: http://wordpress.org/support/topic/resize-images-in-chrome  
12:08 <+mflorea> so yes, it's most probably a Chrome limitation. You can still open the issue, maybe there are workarounds.  
12:08 <vmassol> http://cutesoft.net/forums/thread/66261.aspx  
12:09 <vmassol> so yes  
12:09 <vmassol> seems to be a limitation  
12:09 <+mflorea> yep  
12:10 <vmassol> might be good to indicate it somewhere on xwiki.org as a known limitation on chrome  
12:10 <vmassol> do you know if chrome has an issue tracker?  
12:11 <vmassol> it's probably a webkit issue though  
12:11 <+mflorea> yes, some were saying it's the same in Safary  
12:11 <+mflorea> Safari  
12:12 <vmassol> Per the TinyMCE development staff, it is a resource that is not built into WebKit (which is the core for Safari and a significant part of Chrome). As of March 2010 this was their statement ("The WebKit browser doesn't support live image resizing or even image selection. We are faking that right now, we reported this issue a few years ago to Apple and still no progress", http://tinymce.moxiecode.com/punbb/viewtopic.php?pid=71775) and it s  
12:13 <vmassol> source: http://www.google.com/support/forum/p/Chrome/thread?tid=3b21becc3e4f6b04&hl=en  
12:14 <+mflorea> it's an old issue  
12:15 <vmassol> here's the issue on the webkit tracker: https://bugs.webkit.org/show\_bug.cgi?id=7154  
12:30 <+Denis> vmassol: implementing Comparable for EntityReference parameter also cause a similar issue to clone, since I cannot ensure objects in the map are comparable  
12:37 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
12:38 <vmassol> has quit

13:29 <mflorea> has quit

15:51 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
16:11 <npm\_> is now known as <npm>  
16:54 <sburjan> has quit  
17:18 <vmassol1> I've changed the from to prevent the spam  
17:18 <vmassol1> fyi the xwiki mail server will be migrated in the coming few days to a new machines and it'll use some newer antispam  
17:19 <@cjdelisl1> nice  
17:19 <@cjdelisl1> setting the from and to to the same address is a common tactic  
17:19 <vmassol1> want some fun: try this: http://82.233.128.14:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/My+First+Presentation  
17:19 <vmassol1> (and click on "Run this presentation")  
17:20 <vmassol1> I was told it's taking time to load from remote (it's very fast locally)  
17:21 <@sdumitriu> Trying it with noscript  
17:22 <vmassol1> should be fun...  
17:22 <@sdumitriu> Doesn't look as nice, but it's usable  
18:23 <jvelociter> has quit  
18:24 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
18:50 <@sdumitriu> vmassol1: OK for closing http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-3935 ?  
18:52 <vmassol1> ok although we'll need to figure out something in the longer run  
18:53 <@sdumitriu> In which direction?  
18:53 <vmassol1> no idea…. :)  
19:06 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:15 <+AndreasJonsson> I think that the precedence level of rights should be made more intutive.  I made a suggestion about that some time ago: http://xwiki.markmail.org/message/tmqwvi5owierpgx2?q=right+priority+Andreas+Jonsson  
19:29 <@sdumitriu> AndreasJonsson: OK for group priorities  
19:29 <@sdumitriu> But how should those be defined?  
19:29 <Ruudjah> has joined #xwiki  
19:38 <fmancinelli> has quit  
19:51 <+AndreasJonsson> sdumitriu: A simple scheme is to just say that XWikiAllGroup has low priority and all other groups have the same high priority.  
19:52 <+AndreasJonsson> But the priority can also be exposed as a configurable parameter.  
19:55 <jvelociter> has quit  
20:03 <mflorea> has quit  
20:44 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki

23:49 <vmassol1> has quit
